page.title: 02The Policing of Alderney I
page.content: This information was got from P.C.Richardson,the only local policeman on Alderney.In the winter one sergeant and one constable come over from Guernsey for two week spells.In the summer one constable,one sergeant and one detective constable come over.The sergeants and the constables are responsible for the day to day policing of Alderney.The Detective Constable is involved in the comings and goings at the Harbour and Airfield.He is known as the "Port Watch".They have a record book of lost and found property - which amounts to about 280 items in a single year.They also have a file of robberies.All crimes are kept on a micro-film filing system in Guernsey.Our police station has two prison cells.
